author: MotorizedDoucheCanoe
body: Looks like we’re forming the elusive wu tang symbol on the spy daily

author: IQ74
body:
It is very useful for sending money over international borders.  There is no other quick and cheap way to send money internationally.  I can send 20k to someone in China, Russia, or the US in a matter of minutes with almost no fees.  

Compare that with the hassle and fees associated with a bank wire or going to Western Union.

author: BongRips4Jezus
body: My hands are going to be tested these next few days. Most of my positions are calls for AAPL and MSFT in January. And GLW shares

author: TheTigersAreNotReal
body:
GLW: Glass manufacturer that is used in vials, phones, TVs, and other medical/commercial appliances. They have a contract to produce vials for Pfizer, and received a grant from the government to ensure that they will be able to produce enough vials for the future vaccine. Had their price target upgraded to $33 by Citigroup, currently oversold at $25.75

Don’t know when this thing is gonna moon again, but I hope it’s soon. Probably needs to announce another biomed contract to turn more heads. White knuckling these calls hoping the market realizes its value soon

author: FormalFew
body: Last chance on cheap GLW $30 calls, don't say you weren't warned

author: emtendo
body:
Corning as well (GLW) make the glass bottles that all the vaccines will be stored in...

Edit: got ticker symbol wrong

author: peter-doubt
body:
First: congrats .. good ride!

Second: you beat me in... @70 vs me @140.

Third: we agree .. this price is nuts!  

Percentagewise, your timing has helped you outperform me.  By a long shot!  

What to do next?  I'm looking at SMH.... Semiconductor ETF .. weighted to 5G build out. . oh, NVDA is part of it.

As for dividends.. not much unless you're taking risks with oils, but at 3%, I could suggest Corning (GLW).  Their market volume may be declining, but there's little comment about the volume they can supply to pharma packaging (think billions of doses in glass vials).

Any other ideas?

author: oaklandChi84
body: My GLW and NOK calls are coming back to life. About damn time.

author: math1024
body:
The main difference between 5G and the previous roll outs is just a lot more fiber and small cell antennas. I think the best 5G plays would be fiber companies like GLW, COMM, and OCC.

There's also been [legislation](https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Executive_Order_13858) promoting onshoring so you might want to focus on american manufacturers.

author: TheTigersAreNotReal
body:
GLW reported 5 new insider trades to the SEC yesterday.


$19,709.90 of shares acquired by Henretta Deborah A (Director)


$33,592.30 of shares acquired by Cummings Robert F Jr (Director)   


$11,655.00 of shares acquired by Canning John A Jr  


$24,864.00 of shares acquired by Burns Stephanie (Director)  

$28,179.20 of shares acquired by Martin Kevin J (Director)

author: ValenTom
body:
Initiated a position in Prudential Financial in my Roth IRA today. I was previously targeting Realty Income but the share price is just a tad higher than where I’d like to continue accumulating. As long as PRU stays around these levels I’ll continue accumulating 8-10 shares per month for the foreseeable future. 

Brings my Roth IRA to five total holdings as I develop a DGI portfolio there. 

AT&T

CVS

Corning Glass

Realty Income

Prudential Financial

author: iamfar_
body:
Schott, Corning and BD are all bigger players.

Plus given the timelines of these vaccine projects I doubt pharma companies are going to spend the time to evaluate an alternate container closure system.

author: lilcuci19
body:
" (Reuters) - U.S. drugmaker Pfizer Inc has signed a long-term agreement with glass maker Corning Inc to procure vials for storing drugs, the companies said on Thursday. "

" The U.S. will pay [Pfizer](https://www.cnbc.com/quotes/?symbol=PFE) and biotech firm [BioNTech](https://www.cnbc.com/quotes/?symbol=BNTX) $1.95 billion to produce and deliver 100 million doses of their Covid-19 vaccine  "

author: Zidualz
body:
Found an article by Syntegon, dated June 8, that adds some color on the potential market size for glass vials and many useful tidbits on Corning’s Valor glass. 

GLW previously stated the firm “expect[s] ultimate annual sales to match our cumulative investment level, which could be as much as $4 billion” w.r.t. Valor glass. Same Corning update suggested that this sales levels would materialize upon the product’s “successful adoption” by the market. Reasonably likely that demand from clinical trials and production of Covid vaccine/treatments alone would be sufficient to satisfy the threshold for “successful adoption” if not more; not surprising per se, covid is merely a catalyst. If true, then the marginal contribution of Valor sales to the bottom line will be substantial.

Links to referenced sources:

 [Pharmaceutical Glass Packaging 2017](https://s22.q4cdn.com/662497847/files/doc_news/disclosure/valor_FAQ.pdf)

[Examining Supply Chain Risk For Pandemic Preparedness](https://pharmablog.syntegon.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/8/2020/06/whitepaper-Corning-Valor.pdf)

author: a_s0urlem0n
body: Pfizer and Corning just signed a "multi year" deal that corning would supply Pfizer, this may affect the chances of corning growth with AZN. Both Pfizer and azn have both also commented on the possibility of using a single vial to hold multiple vaccine doses to cut down the need for billions of vials. There will still probably be a strong correlation between the companies though, I think I least.

author: AggregateFundingRisk
body:
i dont need to explain the hype around AZN.. so aside from medical supplies, they create fucking smartphone screens and tv's.. good for tech as well which is going up

https://www.barrons.com/articles/buy-corning-stock-to-play-strong-tv-and-phone-demand-analyst-says-51594916171

5G

https://finance.yahoo.com/news/corning-partners-enersys-accelerate-5g-172405190.html

here is an article on them on medicine, which was my main focus

https://spectrumlocalnews.com/nys/central-ny/coronavirus/2020/06/26/corning-glass-makes-vials-for-covid-19-vaccine

these guys have absolutely no way to fail. they've got their hand in everything, id expect them to go up at least 25% over the month.

author: AggregateFundingRisk
body:
ok well i'll just give you an idea as to what GLW does.

they create the pyrex vials for medicine. if AZN goes up, their production goes up.. they are directly related..

they will move together if the news is good tomorrow.. good results = more production.
